BB51F8FB37E145C98934077D84FE6168.description:
Students work independently to identify a research question based on provided stimulus material; research the issue; analyze, evaluate, and select evidence to develop an argument; present and defend a conclusion; and produce a multimedia presentation to be delivered to their peers.

Evaluation Guideline(s): The syllabus must identify the time and opportunity for students to complete Performance Task 2.

6BDD1A88EC544F48AFDC87AECF521EBB.description:
Students work collaboratively with a team to identify, investigate, analyze, and evaluate a real-world or academic problem or issue; consider and evaluate alternatives or options; propose one or more solutions or resolutions; and present and defend the argument for their solutions through a multimedia presentation.

Evaluation Guideline(s): The syllabus must identify the time and opportunity for students to complete Performance Task 1.

872D44A8FA1D4BF68C82680294C89C2D.description:
Students develop an understanding of the AP Capstone Policy on Plagiarism and Falsification or Fabrication of Information.

Evaluation Guideline(s): The syllabus must include the AP Capstone Policy on Plagiarism and Falsification or Fabrication of Information statement verbatim and in full.

EF7143C4B624415284DAD1A3FBD61109.description:
Students develop an understanding of ethical research practices.

Evaluation Guideline(s): The syllabus must include instruction in acknowledgement, attribution, or citation.

53B09BD31D7043ADAFF1ED1541302AD2.description: Students develop and understanding of ethical research practices and the AP Capstone Policy on Plagiarism and Falsification or Fabrication of Information.

C5E05CF775194179B66A45FC7BA04EF1.description:
Students gain a rich appreciation and understanding of the issues through the following activities: reading articles and research studies; reading foundational, literary, and philosophical texts; viewing and listening to speeches, broadcasts, and/or personal accounts; and experiencing artistic works and performances.

Evaluation Guideline(s): The syllabus must specify the points at which students will engage with texts, labeling at least one from each of the following categories: 
- Articles or research studies
- Foundational, literary, or philosophical texts
- Speeches, broadcasts, or personal accounts
- Artistic works or performances

BB818AAB13F049588E9F592ABD848819.description:
Students develop and apply discrete skills identified in the learning objectives within the Big Idea 5: Team, Transform, and Transmit.

Evaluation Guideline(s): The syllabus must include activities or assignments that allow students to develop oral presentation skills prior to the Performance Tasks.

The syllabus iincludes activities and assignments that allow students to develop written presentation skills prior to the Performance Tasks.

98D6DECDAD58422EAE36C96D0205291D.description:
Students develop and apply discrete skills identified in the learning objectives within the Big Idea 5: Team, Transform, and Transmit.

Evaluation Guideline(s): The syllabus must describe assignments or activities that engage students in the process of reflection. This must be prior to the Performance Tasks.

2AEE335E3A384A339B6306356C58F748.description:
Students develop and apply discrete skills identified in the learning objectives within the Big Idea 5: Team, Transform, and Transmit.

Evaluation Guideline(s): The syllabus must describe assignments or activities where student work as part of a team. This must be prior to Performance Task 1: Team Project and Presentation.

310DF867D9E041DB9337DE52BB5A4421.description:
Students develop and apply discrete skills identified in the learning objectives within the Big Idea 4: Synthesize Ideas.

Evaluation Guideline(s): The syllabus must describe activities or assignments in which students formulate arguments based on synthesis. These must be prior to the Performance Tasks.

088C11644EA84588BC4D6089FF640E6F.description:
Students develop and apply discrete skills identified in the learning objectives within the Big Idea 3: Evaluate Multiple Perspectives.

Evaluation Guideline(s): The syllabus must describe activities or assignments in which students identify and evaluate multiple perspectives on an issue or topic. These must be prior to the Performance Tasks.

2B45BEF9DC64479D92F3A40103AF8230.description:
Students develop and apply discrete skills identified in the learning objectives within the Big Idea 2: Understand and Analyze.

Evaluation Guideline(s): The syllabus must describe activities or assignments in which students analyze and evaluate arguments. These must be prior to the Performance Tasks.

97B2802FA3C344CE9B53E36100124642.description:
Students develop and apply discrete skills identified in the learning objectives within the Big Idea 1: Question and Explore.

Evaluation Guideline(s): The syllabus must demonstrate that students have opportunities to identify a problem or question, access and manage information, or evaluate the credibility of a source. These must be prior to the Performance Tasks.

1CC59AE3C16D4C2E94C77DF77EDE2895.description:
The course provides multiple opportunities for students to practice and refine their skills by engaging with the QUEST process.

Evaluation Guideline(s): The syllabus must demonstrate that QUEST is applied as a holistic process of inquiry. This must be prior to the Performance tasks.

37DE85D6E8B04CFAB0D4C3687E8A2AAA.description: Students develop and apply discrete skills identifies in the learning objectives of the enduring understandings within the following five big ideas: Question and Explore, Understand and Analyze, Evaluate Multiple Perspectives, Synthesize Ideas, and Team, Transform, and Transmit.

D7F9A12CFA3F4B13A8E4BD4B3BEFEA19.description:
Students explore complexities of one or more themes by making connections within, between, and/or among multiple cross-curricular areas and by exploring multiple perspectives and lenses (e.g., cultural and social, artistic and philosophical, political and historical, environmental, economic, scientific, futuristic, ethical) related to those themes.

Evaluation Guideline(s): The syllabus must list one or more cross-curricular topics or themes. The syllabus must demonstrate that students examine different perspectives or lenses on the topic(s) or theme(s).

7D3C6A2B8EE8471CBA6B3CD3BD4FEA94.description: The curricular requirements are the core elements of the course. Your syllabus must provide clear evidence that each requirement is fully addressed in your course.
